doc.previous: Erie's location along the shores of Lake Erie provides a plethora of outdoor activities throughout the year. The region's largest attraction is Presque Isle State Park, drawing over four million visitors a year.[59] The region grows grapes and produces the third largest amount of wine in the United States.[2]
doc.after: Downtown Erie is surrounded by Presque Isle State Park, a National Natural Landmark.[59] The Seaway Trail runs through downtown Erie along the lakefront. The Tom Ridge Environmental Center, at the foot of Presque Isle, features 7,000 square feet (650Â m2) of exhibit space.[60]
